contest-event.event-date:
Jan. 26, 1922 D Australian Championships (A Grade)
Australian Championships (A Grade) 10 Sacred, March, Set Test and Own Choice Contest Australian Championships australian-championships-a-grade
Australia
A Grade
Set Test and Own Choice
Sydney Sports Ground, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia Two own choice selections, no set test.
PROTESTS : The championship ended in turmoil with a number of protests lodged . The initial lodged by Newcastle against South Sydney who were alleged to have played a professional player . Upheld The secretary of the Band Association of N S W ( George Burges ) immediately lodged a protest against the Newcastle band on the same grounds . Upheld A further protest followed against Eastern Suburbs for breach of contest rules . Leichhardt was then awarded the championship with Hurstville 2nd with no 3rd place . South Sydney objected to Hurstville being awarded 2nd place on the grounds the Association allowed it to play a professional cornetist and also a protest had been lodged against Leichhardt The protest against Eastern Suburbs and Leichhardt were dismissed The Association under an avalanche of protests seriously considered declaring it a no contest . A final decision was made 1st Leichhardt District ; 2nd Eastern Suburbs United ; 3rd Hurstville Municipal
Feb. 8, 2016, 4:29 a.m. Dec. 18, 2017, 10:37 a.m.
1 Leichhardt Municipal Ernest Kerry Beethoven's Works [arr. Owen]
2 Eastern Suburbs United H. E. Webb Wagner [arr. Round]
3 Hurstville Municipal Band Stan Nichols
Disqualified Newcastle City Henry Kerry Beethoven's Works [arr. Owen]
Disqualified St. John Ambulance Brigade Band (District of NSW) William Partington Tristan and Isolde
